meanings.definition: A person killed or injured in a war or accident.
meanings.sent1: The hospital received many casualties after the car crash.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers bravely fought, but there were casualties on both sides.
meanings.sent3: The picnic became a casualty of the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of flavors, the spicy salsa was a casualty to the mild guacamole.
meanings.sent5: The casualties of the earthquake left a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.definition: A person or thing badly affected by an event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The business was a casualty of the economic downturn.
meanings.sent2: The environment is often a casualty of industrial development.
meanings.sent3: His favorite shirt became a casualty of the laundry mishap.
meanings.sent4: Her trust in people was a casualty of the betrayal she experienced.
meanings.sent5: The casualties of the storm included many damaged homes and fallen trees.
